title: Group Mentality Concerning Frostblade
body:
This was something I started noticing this morning, but discussions about the new version(s) of Frostblade Irelia are...not discussions at all. Recently, I've seen a few threads post a fan-painted edit of the skin, showing what they believe are improvements to the skin. Of course there are always those who disagree and comment below, but the degree to which those comments have been shouted down is staggering. Without giving my own opinion on the skin itself, I haven't seen Boards be this much of an echo chamber in some time. Sure, pack mentality comes into play in any given thread, its bound to happen, but for every thread that thinks one thing, there's usually a thread that thinks the opposite and is highly upvoted. 

Even dissenting arguments aren't typically downvoted into oblivion on a thread unless they are cruel in some way or flat out incorrect. With these past few threads I've witnessed simple disagreements or sensible counter arguments become "click to show". What is happening? 

Some of these posts aren't aggressive in any way either. I literally saw someone simply say "I like riot's version more" and was downvoted into "click to show" status. Since when are we downvoting pure opinions? These are supposed to be discussions, I thought this was part of why we generally don't like Reddit. Someone disagreeing is not a reason to downvote. 

Again, I'm pretty neutral about the skin, any changes or lack-thereof don't affect me at all. I don't have a horse in this race. But please, try to actually discuss with people and not just hound anyone who may feel strongly in the opposite way to you. That alone is not grounds to silence them.

replies.body: People take this upvote-downvote thing way too personally. It's essentially a voting system: when someone agrees with an idea they vote for it, when they feel neutral or don't care they don't do anything, and when they disagree they downvote to show that they don't like the suggestion. It's not a personal attack, players are just saying what ideas they like and what ideas they don't.

That'd be fine if the system didn't literally hide the comment if it was downvoted enough, partially silencing their argument/opinion. 

When I see something downvoted that low, I assume there's some kind of racial slur or unnecessary personal attack. Not that people just disagree.
I mean I always look at those comments anyways, don't we all?
You do not however scroll to bottom all the time where the most downvoted posts are.
It's actually not intended for if you agree or not. It's for if the comment or post creates good discussion.
